Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Peter S
Reviews.Content: A wonderful residence in probably the best location in Rome. For those that don't know a residence in Italy is like a serviced apartment not a hotel - so you get a bedroom, sitting room and kitchen or kitchenette with maid service each day but don't expect a restaurant on site or pools and so forth - I think one or two of the negative reviews here reflect a lack of understanding as to what the place is... The rooms are clean and have nice views and the Penthouse especially has great views through 360 degrees, water is always hot, linen always clean and the decor might best be described as classic italian (a shabby chic) everything you need is in the rooms (I've stayed many times over the last 8 years and never found a room with no mirrors or places to put luggage as one reviewer suggested) and there are nice Bang Olufsen tv's etc and fast ethernet broadband in every room The staff are very helpful and will look after cases for you, arrange transport, even do laundry etc like a hotel. You get a room key and front door key so you can come and go as you please at all hours though there is a night porter on duty if needed. The hotel is also a modern art gallery with some interesting and diverting pieces around. Its situated close to all the touristy parts of Rome and there is a metro and a taxi rank opposite and a few doors up from the best coffee shop in Rome (Pepey's) The rooms are no the cheapest available but not expensive by Rome standards and what you get is a suite with kitchen and a double sofa bed in the lounge so you could sleep a whole family in the one room rather than just a couple. For a romantic stay then the penthouse with twin patios for private sunbathing is ideal. I've stayed in Rome many times including lovely hotels like the Westin and the Parco de Principei but this is the only place I always go back to now I've found it.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location , location”
Reviews.Author: forevercurious007
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located literally 2 minutes from the Barberini piazza. We (my mom and 6 year old son) stayed in an apartment in the 2nd floor. I would call it guest house or B&B than hotel. It has retained quite a lot of period features. You can look out of the bedroom window and see the row of Roman buildings (i think - as in old Rome!). The room and the hotel too for that matter requires updating - everything looks old and tired. We had booked a 2 bed apartment with kitchen facilities. Staff assistance was a bit of hit and miss! There is a small restaurant just next door to the hotel that does good food, including takeaways, at reasonable prices. The white restaurant (or some white something) around the corner, is terrible. Appearances can be deceptive as it looks great from the outside. The hop on hop off tour point is 5 minutes walk from the residence barberini. The Trevi fountain is about 10 to 15 minutes depending on your speed. Whilst it was a central location. I am not too sure if I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “loved coming home to our apartment in rome”
Reviews.Author: eveiveneg
Reviews.Content: convenient location. not too much in the tourist-filled area, but a few steps away from the metro station, with almost all the famous places within walking distance. good english speaking staff with great recommendations as to groceries to go to, transportation advice, etc. roomy and clean, makes you really feel like you are living in rome.

Reviews.Title: “A bit pricey but right in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: navnov
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Residence Barberini during the half terms in October for 4 nights.. It is located very close to Piazza Barberini and walking distance to Trevi fountain (10 minutes), Colosseum (15-20 minutes), Vittore Emmanuel Monument (10-15 minutes), Pantheon (15 minutes), Piazza Navona (20 minutes).... I know most travellers do extensive walking in Rome but we also used the limited Metro connections to reach Vatican (Ottaviano, Cipro stns), Piazza Del Popolo (Flaminio stn), Colosseum (colosseo stn) and Termini. The residence itself is a bit dated and needs a renovation.. The rooms are spacious and there is 24 hours service (not room service)...Reception was quite helpful in dealing with all our requests. Rooms have fully equipped kitchen, LCD TV with English channels and is serviced daily.. There is no dishwasher but its not a problem and the daily service takes care of dishes. There is no washing machine/dryer but there is public laundry on via Degli Avignonesi.. Its a bit pricey but it scores heavily in terms of its central location!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place - But Beware!”
Reviews.Author: mspragmatic
Reviews.Content: There isn't a better place to stay in central Rome: quiet, large suites, very helpful and knowledgeable staff. But be cautious: I had $1500.00 stolen from my room, undoubtedly by the housekeeping staff. Of course it was denied. Yes, I should have used the safe, no doubt. My disappointment lies in the fact that the owner avoided me for four days after I reported the incident, despite promises that he would talk to me about it. This indifference put a damper on an otherwise very enjoyable visit. Moral: lock up everything valuable!

Reviews.Title: “I will stay somewhere else next visit to Rome.”
Reviews.Author: Canadiantraveller42
Reviews.Content: This is not a standard hotel and it's hard to find at first. There's no sign, only a brass logo beside the door and the numbers "171" to show the street address. It appears to have been a small apartment building at one time and they've converted each of the two suites per floor into a hotel room. I would guess there's no more than 12 rooms in the hotel. There is no restaurant and the lobby consists of a small desk, staffed by one person, and a sofa. There is a bellman during the day but at night, the entrance door is locked and you must get the attention of the night watchman to enter if you don't have a room key to open the outside door. My husband and I arrived on separate flights and even though I pointed out to the evening person and then the night attendant (at 11:30 pm) that he would be arriving just after midnight, he was not able to get in and was left standing on the street for 20 minutes until he was able to wake me via cell phone. I had to go downstairs to let him in and had to walk by the office in the lobby where I could hear the load snoring of the night watchman. A bomb could have gone off and he wouldn't have responded! My husband was dressed in a business suit, carrying a briefcase and felt very exposed at that time of night as the hookers and others spotted him banging on the door of his "hotel". The front desk staff were helpful and the rooms were very clean but many little things like no drinking glasses in the room one night, a wasp's nest on the ceiling of the main room, a running toilet, the cover for the toilet flusher fell off in my hand once, no blanket on the bed, only a sheet and a heavier sheet for a cover, no soap dish in the shower so you needed to hold the soap in your hand, the closet was in the middle of the hallway, no mirror in the bedroom.....all added up for a negative experience for us. I've read the other reviews and if you needed a small kitchen to feed a child and an extra room to spread out a lot of gear, this would work but as a middle-aged couple looking for a secure and comfortable place to stay, we were disappointed. We stayed three days and then returned for another night at the end of our trip. We were travelling with 3 other couples and we all left a suitcase in storage while we were travelling in the countryside. My friend had 2 pairs of expensive shoes stolen from her suitcase while our bags were stored with the hotel. We were NOT impressed!

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel/residence in the great location”
Reviews.Author: yanka7
Reviews.Content: If you are traveling with the family, this is a great hotel. They offer suites with 2 rooms that are very convenient for families with children. Suites have small kitchens with sink and refrigerator, which is very convenient also. We have stayed in this hotel many years ago and unfortunately it was not renovated since. The rooms are simple, but clean. Some negatives: the sleeper sofa in the family room had a really bad mattress, not the best sleep quality; one day the toilet broke in our room (it got fixed the same day). Location is great, walking distance to all major attractions. Will recommend this hotel to families. If you don't need 2 rooms, you can probably find a better place.

Reviews.Title: “My best stay in Rome, yet! Couldn't beat the location.”
Reviews.Author: donnainnapoli
Reviews.Content: The Residence Barberini offers comfortable apartments within close proximity to the Spanish Steps. My husband and I traveled to Rome with our 2 year old son, and found these apartments suited our needs perfectly. The rooms are spacious and comfortable, allowing plenty of room for the 3 of us. We were lucky enough to stay in the beautiful penthouse suite, complete with views of The Pantheon and St. Peter's Basilica. The two terraces were a wonderful place to enjoy a bottle of wine after a long day seeing the sights in Rome. I loved the close proximity to the Spanish Steps and Villa Borghese. If you drive to Rome, there is a parking garage literally right around the corner from the apartment, which we found quite convenient. Another perk of staying in this hotel is that they don't require a minimum night stay AND they provide daily cleaning service. I would most definitely stay at Residence Barberini again!

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: BJGfrankfurt
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for Christmas Holiday and over all it was a good experience. PROS: The staff was GREAT I mean they could not have done more for us. The location is awesome very close to everything and being near the Metro station was handy “2 euro for two people to take the Metro easy and a bargain”. Close to a Grocery store to get stuff for breakfast and whatever. Cons: Our room was a little worn not to bad and a wake up call that never came. No sign in font of the hotel. The only thing that bugged me was that we were on the third floor and at the landing of the emergency escape stairs was an unbelievable stack of boxes. I mean their must have been 70 boxes and you could just get around them. Now, the elevator was slow and only could fit 3 people 4 at most. So, in the event of a fire “which you should not use the elevator anyway” A) the boxes catch fire and your blocked in or contribute to the blaze or B) someone bumps into them as they are hurrying out they collapse and they impede the exit until you can clear a path thus slowing your Egress. I brought this to the staffs attention they appeared unconcerned. I mean the likely hood of such an event happening is rare but if it did you would likely be hosed. I guess you could jump it is only three stories and come away with broken bones and such. This would be a fire code violation in the United States but when in Rome well you know the rest. Bottom line: I would stay here again if they trash the boxes.

Reviews.Title: “Elbow room and location-best value in Rome”
Reviews.Author: mmccahill
Reviews.Content: We arrived early and the front desk took our bags and we headed to lunch while the room was cleaned. Returning from lunch, we picked up the key and took the funky elevator to Suite 11. I looked through several open doors thinking that one would lead to our room. I soon realized that ALL the rooms were included in the suite--two bedrooms, a sitting room, a large corridor and a bathroom the size of most Rome hotel rooms and a balcony with views of St Paul's. We stayed for 5 nights. Great location-within walking distance of almost all of the attractions and a 3 minute walk to the Metro. Great front desk service--helpful with arranging trips and providing transportation. We will definitely stay at the Residence Barbarini when we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Views and lots of room for our daughter”
Reviews.Author: Booboomama
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the rooftop penthouse of this hotel and it was perfect for us. My husband and I brought our 2 year old daughter along and there was so much space for her to run around and play. The 2 patios are huge and the view is brethtaking. Absolutely a hidden gem. The hotel will do a room service breakfast, or send ice, but that's it. The kitchenette came in very hany. The hotel decor is very modern and the front desk staff were always very helpful and perfectly fluent in english. The location couldn't be better as well - just far enough away from the major attractions to save a bit of money, but still within short walking distance. The downside: the bathroom is TINY... that's all I can think of!!

Reviews.Title: “Home in Rome”
Reviews.Author: dt0keefe
Reviews.Content: Great place. The surprisingly spacious apartments really make you feel like you have a home in Rome, rather than just a hotel room. The contemporary art collection throughout the hotel is clever and interesting. Excellent location and free Internet. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: L3648
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the penthouse suite which is suite number 12. You have 2 private terraces [one at either end of the suite] which are worth the extra money. One terrace looks out to the back and you can see St Peters which is illuminated at night. The terrace to the front is the larger terrace which has the sun canopy over. There is a noisy extractor fan but we quickly realised that you just need to turn off the air conditioning to switch off this extractor while sitting outside. The suite felt spacious and had everything we needed... except a security deposit box which was a bit of a pain. I believe the other suites have one but for some reason they didn't put one in the penthouse suite. Location is just amazing. A short walk takes you to the Trevi fountain. I would agree with the other reviewer, probably about 7 minutes. The Barberini metro station is almost just across the road from the hotel and is highly recommended for getting around Rome. 1E will get you a 75 minute journey. The vatican is only 4 stops away and so is the Colloseum [change lines at Termini]. Very clean, cheap and efficient - nothing like the London Underground! Anyway, getting back to the hotel. I would recommend it to anyone planning a break in Rome. Decoration is mimalistic and walls are painted a fresh white. Very clean. The main living area has a kitchen corner which has a fridge [with small freezer compartment within], small hob, kettle and a small selection of crockery and cutlery. There is a little supermarket about 5 minutes away so you can stock up on things for breakfast etc. Also in the living area is a sofa bed, dining table with 2 chairs, TV, small unit which has the Sky box in it and a closet. The bedroom has a king size bed and a table either side. The bedroom has a huge window which overlooks the terrace to the back. The bathroom has sink, toilet, bidet and shower. The shower is roomy although not a huge amount of head height. That said my husband is 6'3" and still managed to fit in! The door to the apartment is very secure. Downstairs there is a separate door for access which you have a key for which saves coming through reception, there is also an intercom for the suites here. There is a small lift. There are plenty of restaurants and shops in the area. The air conditioning is very efficient and was brilliant considering how hot it is outside in August! The daily cleaning service was brilliant. It appeared that the bedding was changed every day. There is some artwork in the hotel that wasn't really to my taste and some nudity in some pictures. This hotel is gay friendly. The staff were very helpful in arranging airport transfers by car, which will cost 70E. All in all if I was to return to Rome I would definitely stay here again and I would highly recommend it. The penthouse is probably ideal for two people. The biggest plus is the location and the space in the apartment, particularly the terraces!

Reviews.Title: “Just great”
Reviews.Author: anvas
Reviews.Content: Great location – right in the heart of the city and close to almost everything a tourist must see in Rome (Trevi fountain and Spanish steps – 7 min, Colliseo and Forum – a nice 30 minute walk, Vatican - 4 short stops on the metro (station 200 meters from the hotel), etc.). Also right in the center of great shopping area. Very friendly and helpful staff. Professional service. Large, well maintained, clean appartments. Great for a family stay (we traveled with our 20 year old daughter). Decorated with lots of imagination. Some art may surprise parents with small kids, but if you are in Rome, you see artistic nudity on every corner anyway. A Russian family from Switzerland

Reviews.Title: “Rome”
Reviews.Author: JoecDelaware
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed Rome immensely. Stayed at the Barberini B&B near Trevi fountain. Loved the apartment and location. The owners were great. Recommend it highly for all visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent All The Way”
Reviews.Author: PaulKeshvari
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with my wife and two teenagers. It was fantastic all the way, friendly staff, clean suites, with plenty of room for four of us, walking distance to all attractions, literally one minutes walking to subway and taxi station, and more. Overall it was the best experience I had in Rome. I highly recommend this place to anyone visiting Rome. [-]

Reviews.Title: “Nice apartments, great location.”
Reviews.Author: jvangend
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Residence Barberini for 5 nights during our holiday to Rome. Our suite is spacious and adequately appointed; it overlooks the courtyards behind the hotel so our sleep was not disturbed by the noise of the main street. The location is really good and the Barberini train station is only a 3-minute walk away. We found the in-room folder particularly helpful, more specifically the restaurant recommendations, as it lists the culinary highlights of Rome which is incredibly helpful given the bewildering array of Italian restaurants and cafes in the city. We ate at several of the recommended restaurants and were not disappointed at all. Not so good points: The air-conditioning is one of the noisiest we experienced. The same can be said of the extractor fan in the bathroom. Housekeeping is clean but, as one of the reviewers had mentioned, our toiletries were not replaced, neither were the dirty linen put in the basket and complimentary tea bags, sugar and coffee in the pantry. Lastly, it took them two days to send an iron and ironing board to the room (they only have one iron in the residence apparently). All factors weighed up, we had a fuss-free stay and will definitely consider staying there on our return.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel in Rome ? Maybe, It's better a Residence !!!!”
Reviews.Author: fotinos_paula
Reviews.Content: Have booked with RoomsAccomodation before and was happy with the accurate description of the locations booked. For our 3rd vacation to Rome, my father and I decided to rent an apartment instead of an hotel room. It was definitely the right choice! We were extremely happy with the fabulous location of Residence Barberini. It seemed as though we really were in the best location of the city. It is right next to the Barberini square, the end of Via Veneto and just a 5 minutes walking to the Spanish Steps and other beautiful and historical locations. The best part of renting an apartment is that we had a kitchen. The supermarket was not far of a walk and the best outdoor market right on our street! Fresh fruits and veggies everyday Overall, our experience was wonderful and I would definitely recommend to rent this property. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Good Rooms, Bad Housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: ActiveTravel_34
Reviews.Content: Rooms are big, and clean, however, housekeeping kept stealing a bottle a day from minibar (hopefully nothing else) and never added a single bar of soap even though we stayed five nights... Too bad, with improved housekeeping standard this hotel would have rated much higher.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel and location!”
Reviews.Author: BethBoston_MA
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in May and thought the hotel was fabulous. The rooms were large (especially by European standards), very clean and simply but elegantly decorated. We stayed in Suite 7 which was on the back of the building which tended to be quieter. The location is great - 10 min walk to the Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps but also just one block from the Metro system at the Barberini station - this made it easy to travel around out to the Vatican and back to Termini to catch our train to the airport. The staff here was very friendly and accomodating. They will help you with any information you need - closest ATM, train and travel information, etc. There is a grocery store about a 10 minute walk away on the Via Nationale and we were able to buy breakfast food, snacks and water to keep in the kitchen which was much cheaper than going out or buying water at tourist locations. The room was well kept and the staff even waited until we went out each day to make up the room (on our first day we slept in and didn't leave until 1pm and the desk waited until they saw us leave for the day to have housekeeping come.) The rooms have Bang & Olufson TVs with DVD players and Sky Satelitte TV and there is free internet in the lobby (they have a free and very recent DVD collection that you can borrow from). Overall I would highly recommend staying here - especially for famillies or two couples since there are two separate bedrooms (one w/a bed, one w/a comfortable pull out couch)- see attached photos.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service Grade "F"”
Reviews.Author: LimerickPiece
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Residence Barberini was less than acceptable. At the door, we were told due to our shuttle driver having to wait for us (flight was late; no fault of our own) that we would be charged an extra 30Euro. That immediately set the tone for the rest of our stay here. We resided at the Barberini for 4 days and 3 nights. The hotel was clean and stylish and centrally located (if you don't mind the hustle and bustle of downtown Rome). But the customer service was very unsatisfactory. The staff seemed less than interested in our needs and/or comfort while there. We were not greeted most times as we entered and left the premises and just did not experience the customer service you would expect a hotel of that caliber to provide. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone regardless of the interesting art collection throughout the hotel and it's stylish apartments. Not worth the cost or the service.

Reviews.Title: “Was not the greatest for us.”
Reviews.Author: vacation200807
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel very clean and spacious but the hallways smelled very mildewy/moldy and the air conditioning fan was extremely noisy. We checked in took a look around and went looking for another hotel as we wanted a hotel we could enjoy spending time in. The rooms themselves were nicely furnished - just a warning if you have small children there is a full size mummy in the stairway of the 2nd to 3rd floor that could be frightful to them. The DVD player and movie loans were great and the internet access in the lobby was wonderful. Staff was also very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Ideal for families with kids”
Reviews.Author: PVmomontherun2
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Italy and we stayed at Residence Barberini for three nights. The hotel was more than adequate for our needs. It had a large master bedroom, a living room with a sofa bed, a small kitchen and a large bathroom with a shower. We stayed in Suite # 2 which was on the 2nd floor. The rooms were nice and clean which was important to me. The refrigerator in the small kitchen was perfect as it enabled us to store drinks and breakfast items. The kitchen was also very well equipped with plates and cutlery and even pots and pans if you are inclined to cook. The Barberini is actually more like an apartment hotel (apartelle) than a hotel. So if you are expecting a hotel then this place is not for you...They do not have a concierge like the big hotels and the front desk staff although very nice and very friendly could not cater to your needs like a concierge does. The Barberini does not have a large sign in front so it might be difficult to find it when you first arrive. We actually arranged for the hotel shuttle to pick us up from the airport and it cost Euro 65 for a family of four. If money is not an issue for you, I would definitely suggest this option as it was more relaxing to arrive in Rome knowing that the driver was not out to get us. Location was also an added bonus....You could walk to the Trevi Fountain and to the Spanish steps. It will take you about 10 minutes to walk to either location. As a matter of fact, we managed to walk to the Trevi Fountain on the night we arrived and managed to catch it while it was still light since it was so close by (We arrived at about 8:00 PM). If you read Angels and Demons and want to follow the the walk of Bernini's Rome (as described in DK Guidebook for Rome), the hotel is a good base to start from.... We were very happy at Residence Barberini, my husband says he would definitely go back there and it was my son's favorite hotel in Italy which is saying a lot cause we stayed in a 5 star hotel in Siena and a 4 Star hotel in Venice. The Residence Barberini is definitely ideal for families with kids...

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Residence Barberini in early April for 5 nights. Ended up staying in two different suites (#8 and #12). #12 is the penthouse so when it opened up, grabbed it for a couple of nights. We were in Rome the days leading up to and after the Pope's funeral so the City was very busy. I was staying there with myself, two teenagers and one toddler. Here are my impressions: Cleanliness: Excellent. Rooms: Excellent. The penthouse is probably best for 2 people as the sofa bed in the living area is not very comfortable. We did OK with it and really liked the views the two patios offered from the suite. However suite #8 worked out well for our family of four. The rooms also included small kitchens and that was welcomed by our whole family. Staff: Excellent. David was very helpful in trying to locate a Kodak battery charger that I couldn't seem to find on my own. He went out of his way to make my kids feel comfortable and meet our needs. The remaining staff was also very good. They had good restaurant, market and shopping recommendations. Hotel Location: Very central but a bit hard to find. Seems the property isn't well known yet so shuttle and cab drivers had a hard time finding. It's right off Barbarini Square (big fountain in the middle of traffic) and has a market, pharmacy and other conveniences close by. Ammenities: The hotel's satellite TV actually worked and the free internet access they had available in a small office off the lobby made my teenagers very happy. It also helped me stay in touch with my office after my Blackberry died. Overall: Would stay here again in a heart beat, especially if I could get the penthouse. The views of the City it offered are excellent and worth the extra money.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel for travelers with more than 2 ppl”
Reviews.Author: amiprice
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Residence Barberini in August 2004 and found it to be an excellent hotel. There were 4 adults and we wanted to find a hotel where we could split a room - this was excellent for that. The room was about the size of a standard 1 bedroom apartment in the US and had a pull-out sofa so that all 4 adults could sleep comfortably. We also had privacy due to the layout of the room. Another bonus is having a kitchen - because drinks are very expensive in Rome, we found a grocery store and stocked up on water and soda for the room - big plus for the hot days in Rome. The location is great, right by a Metro line, within walking distance from the Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, Pantheon, and many other sites in Rome. Of course, Rome is a walking city, because their subway system is really inadequate, but you can also pick up many buses at Piazza Barberini. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish apartments in great location”
Reviews.Author: OnThePoint
Reviews.Content: Residence Barbarini on the Via Quattro Fontani, just a few metres from Piazza Barbarini was a wonderful base for our family during a week in Rome in January 2004. The location is terrific. A couple of hundred metres from the Spanish Steps in one direction, the Trevi fountain in another and the Via Veneto in another and with the Palazzo Barbarini art gallery just next door, we were delighted. The reception is small but ultra trendy with extremely friendly and helpful staff. This is an old building, but the apartments have been very well renovated with lots of marble and some quite unique artworks. The views from our apartment were limited but charming - up the Via Quattro Fontani, a quaint street with lots of activity. There are lots of restaurants about, a pharmacy right opposite and an internet cafe about 50m away. The kitchen was a little dingy (no natural light) but we ate out most of the time. The other rooms were fine and the bathroom very pleasant. This is classic boutique accomodation, with the sort of quirks that make you pleased you didn't book into an international hotel. We felt very much part of Rome. The only drawback is lack of facilities like pool & gym.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed experience - but good for families”
Reviews.Author: RT
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice (at either end of a 2 week holiday). The first time was fantastic - lovely room, fantastic service and staff helpful in every way. The second time the room was cramped with a grotty outlook. Several things didn't work and staff didn't seem to care less! However the apartment layout - bedroom and separate living room with up to 3 sofa beds makes it ideal for families. There is also a small kitchen area so again useful if you have small children. The location is great - right near Piazza Barberini and 2 minutes from Via Veneto, 10 min walk to Spanish steps or Trevi fountain (quicker without small children in tow!)

HotelInfo.Name: Residence Barberini
HotelInfo.Address: Via delle Quattro Fontane 171/172, 00184 Rome, Italy
